name: 朱子偉
objective:
This course aims to introduce the configuration of system analysis and water resources system.  Secondly, it elaborate the theoretical bases and operation procedures of common deterministic mathematical programming methods (linear programming, dynamic programming and nonlinear programming).  Finally, several water resources systems based on the characteristics of surface water, reservoirs and cities will be depicted and perform the optimal and most effective planning, development, management and operation of water resources (including water quantity and water quality).
Objectives:
(1)To understand concepts and algorithms for optimization using linear, integer, network, nonlinear, and dynamic programming;
(2)To understand the concepts of optimization as applied to water resources problems.
schedule:
Unit 1: Planning and Analysis of Water Resource System
Unit 2: Identification and Evaluation of Water Management Plans
Unit 3: Objective Functions and Constraint Equations
Unit 4: Linear Programming
Unit 5: Network Programming
Unit 6: Water Quality Modelling and Prediction
Unit 7: Analytic hierarchy process
materials:
1.Loucks D. P., J. R. Stedinger, and D. A. 1981. Haith. Water Resource Systems Planning and Analysis. Prentice-Hall, Inc.
2.Mays L. W. and Y. -K. Tung. 1992. Hydrosystems Engineering and Management. McGraw-Hill, Inc.
3.Bazaraa M. S. and J. J. Jarvis. Linear Programming and Network Flows. 1977. John Wiley & Sons, Inc.
4.Phillips D. T. and A. Garcia-Diaz. Fundamentals of Network Analysis. 1981. Prentice-Hall, Inc.
